availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Walker Sublett (Hickman County, Kentucky, resident.)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Son of William E. Sublett and Mary E. Sublett. Attended school in Hickman County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Hickman County in 1860. Household owned six enslaved Hickman County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, pp. 27B-28A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 469.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 205B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Alabama, Montgomery County, Montgomery Ward 3, p. 476A.
"William W. Sublett (1838-1892)," Find A Grave, Memorial 81599122, accessed November 3, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81599122.
